meanings.definition: The distance that a bow can shoot an arrow.
meanings.sent1: He measured the field in bowshots to see if his bow could reach the target.
meanings.sent2: The archer aimed carefully and released the arrow, sending it flying several bowshots away.
meanings.sent3: The bow was feeling proud of its ability to cover long bowshots.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a bow that could shoot arrows for endless bowshots.
meanings.sent5: The forest stretched out before him, each tree standing at different bowshots from the next.

meanings.definition: The act of shooting a bow.
meanings.sent1: She practiced her bowshots every day to improve her accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The competition was fierce, with each participant showcasing their best bowshots.
meanings.sent3: The bowshots at the tournament were so impressive that even the birds stopped to watch.
meanings.sent4: His focus during the bowshots was like a laser beam, hitting the target every time.
meanings.sent5: The sound of bowshots echoed through the valley as the archers trained for the upcoming battle.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement equal to the distance a bow can shoot an arrow.
meanings.sent1: The map was marked with bowshots to help travelers estimate the distance.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization used bowshots as a standard unit for measuring land.
meanings.sent3: The tailor used bowshots of fabric to create the perfect outfit for the archer.
meanings.sent4: In his mind, time was not measured in hours but in bowshots of memories.
meanings.sent5: The treasure was said to be buried three bowshots from the old oak tree, hidden from plain sight.
